statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: As we all know, in the computer science, an integer A is in the range of 32-signed integer, which means the integer A is between -2^31 and (2^31)-1 (inclusive), and A is a 64-signed integer, which means A is between -2^63 and (2^63)-1(inclusive). Now we give the K-signed range, and two K-signed integers A and B, you should check whether the sum of A and B is beyond the range of K-signed integer or not.

statement.title: Input
statement.content: There will be many cases to calculate. In each case, there comes the integer K (2<=K<=64) first in a single line. Then following the line, there is another single line which has two K-signed integers A and B.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each case, you should estimate whether the sum is beyond the range. If exceeded, print “Yes”, otherwise “WaHaHa”.
